Class Laser

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameObject
      • Laser

  • public class Laser
extends GameObject
    The "Laser" class, a type of GameObject in the shape of two points (a line). Has the ability to set its end point based on the direction the laser is headed to, and the x-component to be added. Used in the Game class and is constantly "extended" until the laser hits another object.
    Version:
    V1.0.0, 10 June, 2014
    Author:
    Illya Pilipenko, modified by Erik Trinh

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Laser(int x, int y, int angle)
      A constructor for the class, sets the x-coord, y-coord, and angle, and sets up the starting point and current end point (which initially is the same as the starting point).

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void extend(int length)
      Extends laser to (getX () + length, and the corresponding y-coordinate based on the angle), setting currPoint to these coordinates, based on the laser's angle and starting point.
      java.awt.Point getCurrPoint()
      Returns currPoint, or the current end point of the laser.
      java.awt.Point getStartPoint()
      Returns startPoint, the starting point of the laser.
      int getX2()
      Returns the x-coord for the end point.
      int getY2()
      Returns the y-coord for the end point.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Laser

        public Laser(int x,
     int y,
     int angle)
        A constructor for the class, sets the x-coord, y-coord, and angle, and sets up the starting point and current end point (which initially is the same as the starting point).
        Parameters:
        x - int for the x-coord.
        y - int for the y-coord.
        angle - int for the angle.

    • Method Detail

      • extend

        public void extend(int length)
        Extends laser to (getX () + length, and the corresponding y-coordinate based on the angle), setting currPoint to these coordinates, based on the laser's angle and starting point. If the angle is too narrow, which creates the potential to skip y's (making it possible to not detect a collision with another object), then it will extend on the y-axis instead and calculate the correspoint x-coordinate.
        Parameters:
        length - int for the length of one component to extend by, calculating the other component based off of this.
        angle - int for the current angle of this laser.

      • getCurrPoint

        public java.awt.Point getCurrPoint()
        Returns currPoint, or the current end point of the laser.
        Returns:
        the Point currPoint, or the current end point of the laser.

        public java.awt.Point getStartPoint()

      • getY2

        public int getY2()
        Returns the y-coord for the end point.
        Returns:
        integer of the value of the y-coord of the end point
